reason: The proof claims E_{mu_eps}[exp(alpha <f, :phi_eps^2:>)] <= C(alpha,f,lambda) UNIFORMLY in eps, but this is false. Converting Wick powers to raw powers: the constant terms include -alpha C_eps(0) int f dx and -3 lambda C_eps(0)^2 |T^3|, which are O(C_eps(0)^2) ~ O(eps^{-2}). Even after the mass counterterm absorbs the leading 6 lambda C_eps(0) int phi^2 divergence, the pure-constant contributions to the exponent diverge as eps -> 0. The Z_eps^{-1} normalization does NOT cancel these because Z_eps^{-1} contains exp(+3 lambda C_eps(0)^2 |T^3| + delta_m^2 C_eps(0)|T^3|) from its own Wick-to-raw conversion, but the alpha-dependent constant -alpha C_eps(0) int f dx remains. The bound therefore grows at least as exp(|alpha| C_eps(0) |int f|) which diverges, making Fatou vacuous. The proof must work with the combined Wick-ordered quantity <f, :phi_eps^2:> without decomposing into divergent raw-power pieces, or use a fundamentally different argument.
